data.title: Sysout-Calls in AWTPanel #539
data.body:
The original pull request #540 has been merged into master instead of v3.1. Cherry picked the corresponding commit from master and merged it with v3.1.

See issue #539 for further information.

data.title: use the resizable parameter instead of a default 'true' value
fixed a problem with converting blend file when there are unsupportedâ€¦
data.body:
Fixed a problem with converting blend file when there are unsupported textures.
for example:

data.title: 3DS Max 2017 Support?
data.body: There seems to be very little support of 3DSMax OgreMax Exporter is not working and most links on their site are broken. It seems impossible to import any animations into JM3 from 3DSMax. Is there a chance you're adding this support? Blender is not an option and even when I try exporting from blender I get a lot of issues.

data.title: Crash on jme start

data.title: Fixed some problems with getting an address of an LWJGL buffer.
data.body: Fixed some problems with getting an address of an LWJGL buffer.

data.title: fix mixed up javadoc description of euler angles
data.body:
I've noticed that the javadoc of the euler angle methods was incorrect and confusing, so I created this PR

- remove confusing description to fromAngles()
- fix incorrect description of toAngles()
- fix typo rall => roll

data.title: Revert "Cleanup build scripts (3.1)"
data.body: Reverts jMonkeyEngine/jmonkeyengine#573

data.title: Implemented auto free LWJGL byte buffers.
data.body: Implemented auto free LWJGL byte buffers.

data.title: added reusing position buffer on heightmap changing.
data.body: I had a problem with direct memory cost when I very often make some changes of terrain heightmap(terrain editor). It took a lot of direct memory(8GB). So I have found a place on code where we can see, that we re-create a position buffer for each change. I have replaced it to reusing current position buffer.

data.title: Make TempVars Closeable
data.body:
TempVars should be a Closeable or AutoCloseable class. The close method would simply return the object to the stack. This would allow methods that burrow a TempVars object to use a try-with-resource construct to return the object even in case of an exception or any other kind of return. 

On that occasion temp vars could also throw a more meaningful exception if too many objects are borrowed.

data.title: Removed the override that avoided a CompoundCollisionShape to be scaled
data.body: There is no explanation why this should be required, and NemesisMate says he tested it, and could not reproduce some of the older issues. It might have been solved with changes since then.

data.title: The stable release should not be marked as "Pre-release"
data.body:
Currently the release tag `v3.1.0-stable` is marked as "Pre-release" (see attached screenshot) although the name states it is stable. Isn't this somewhat contradictory?

![jmonkeyengine-pre-release](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/343302/22929768/9009843a-f2bd-11e6-8089-13dc9c481d2c.png)

data.title: Deprecated VRApplication. Now VRAppState should be used.
data.body:
Added a VREnvironment class that gather the VR related stuff. A VR environment has to be instanciated and initialized in order to know if the system can use VR display.

With this class, it is now possible to know if the system can be used with VR before any JMonkey use. It is so possible to decide if the VRAppState can be attached to the application or not.

An updated version of the sample application can be found [here](https://hub.jmonkeyengine.org/t/official-vr-module/37830/32?u=seinturier)

data.title: FlyByCamera inconsistencies (bugs when using setUp(z-axis) )
Fixed a exception in Material toString with blender materials.
data.body:
Some blender materials have null Material Param keys. This shouldn't
throw an exception in a toString method. So rather than throwing a
OperaitonNotSupported exception a string is returned informative of the
null state of the key.

data.title: Fix bullet crash when MeshCollisionShape is loaded from j3o [v3.1]

data.title: Jme3 vr dev
data.body:
I propose a new JMonkey module dedicated to Virtual Reality rendering (VR). This integration is a fork of the original phr00t [JMonkeyVR ](https://www.google.fr/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwjp2vTF_9_RAhXLiRoKHRCBDD0QFggaMAA&url=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Fphr00t%2FjMonkeyVR&usg=AFQjCNHQ167Xu07HfX0HPcIvFeMdaVwnRA&sig2=-ArPTml-l9fhIyX2M60-3Q&bvm=bv.145063293,d.ZGg) library that was built on a customized version of JMonkey.

I've modified the VR specific module in order to make it integrate with official JMonkey release (and without refactoring any JMonkey core content).

This VR module relies on either OpenVR or OSVR underlying system. It enables to make VR rendering on various devices (HTC vive, PlaystationVR, ...) using one of the previousle cited API.

I've tested and i'm using this module to produce VR demos.

If i can access the JMonkey wiki, i will provide a simple tutorial for using VR capabilities within JMonkey environment. I've not included any example within the actual module as i want to minimize its dependencies (actually only jme3-core, jme3-effects and jme3-lwjgl3).

I hope that this work will interest you.

data.title: Added position to all lights
data.body:
I need to store a position of all kinds of light. I don't know how to implement it without core changes and without using light nodes. By the way, 3 of 5 light types using a position, so these changes help with reusing the code.
I provide directly editing of lights in my editor without a LightNode, because we should not have unnecessary nodes in your scene to edit a light. Maybe do you have else ideas about how to implement it?
http://imgur.com/a/rRZdE

same diff I committed to 'master' on Jan 14, 2017 only without altering the line endings in Vector3f.java
Without this change, the magnitude of the project() result is incorrect unless 'other' is a unit vector.
